info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 10 at 10:06AM CDT by NWS Shreveport LA
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Shreveport has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Louisiana...
Bodcau Bayou At Bayou Bodcau Lake affecting Webster and Bossier Parishes.
For the Bodcau Bayou...including Bayou Bodcau Lake...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Bodcau Bayou at Bayou Bodcau Lake.
* WHEN...From Friday, June 20 until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 172.0 feet, Expect bankfull conditions on Red Chute Bayou.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 169.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 171.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Friday, June 20 and continue rising to 172.0 feet Friday, June 20. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 172.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 172.5 feet on 04/14/1961. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: https://water.noaa.gov/wfo/SHV
The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 1015 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY, JUNE 20 UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE
